intro: Corydalis harry-smithii, commonly known as Harry-Smith's Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant features slender, ascending stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and rarity, it is considered a valuable species in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
